satellite_network_attribute_functions.cost_function module¶

satellite_network_attribute_functions.cost_function.cost_function(visibility: ndarray, time_visibility: ndarray, distance: ndarray, sunlight: ndarray, alpha: float, beta: float, gamma: float, total_satellites: int) → ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the cost matrix (the weight of each edge in an undirected graph representing a satellite network where edges are potential ISLs and nodes are satellites).

Parameters:

  • visibility – adjacency matrix such that if satellites i and j are visible to one another, visibility[i][j] == 1, else 0

  • time_visibility – adjacency matrix such that time_visibility[i][j] is equal to the number of future snapshots that i and j will be visible to one another

  • distance – an adjacency matrix where each element represents the distance between a satellite pair

  • sunlight – an adjacency matrix such that if sunlight[i][j] == 1, either satellite i or satellite j is vulnerable to solar flares

  • alpha – a weight applied in the cost function to the time visibility value of edge ij

  • beta – a weight applied in the cost function to the physical distance between satellites i and j

  • gamma – a weight applied in the cost function to the solar flare vulnerability value of edge ij

  • total_satellites – the number of satellites in the network

Returns:

an adjacency matrix such that the value at cost_matrix[i][j] is equal to the cost on edge ij

LEO_Satellite_Network_Topology_Design
